info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 13 at 6:28PM EDT until July 13 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Cabarrus County in the piedmont of North Carolina... Northeastern Gaston County in the piedmont of North Carolina... South Central Iredell County in the piedmont of North Carolina... Eastern Lincoln County in the piedmont of North Carolina... Northern Mecklenburg County in the piedmont of North Carolina... * Until 930 PM EDT. * At 628 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 2 inches of rain has fallen from previous thunderstorms. New storms are moving into the area bringing very high rainfall rates. Due to the slow moving nature of these storms,flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Huntersville, Kannapolis, Downtown Concord, Central Charlotte, Northeast Charlotte, East Charlotte, Northwest Charlotte, West Concord, Cornelius, Mt Holly, Davidson, Belmont, Harrisburg, Stanley, Enochville, Westport, Mt Pleasant, University City, Coddle Creek Reservoir and Charlotte Motor Speedway. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1 INCH IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
